key_insight: LongFly integrates long-horizon spatiotemporal context into UAV vision-and-language navigation, enabling more accurate semantic alignment and stable path planning in dynamic, high-information environments.
problem_solved: Existing UAV VLN approaches fail to model long-term spatiotemporal dependencies in complex, rapidly changing scenes (e.g., post-disaster), causing misaligned language-visual grounding and unstable or short-sighted trajectories during long-horizon missions.
method: Spatiotemporal context encoder that aggregates long-term visual, pose, and timeline information using temporal attention and a compact memory bank.
Cross-modal alignment via a multimodal transformer that fuses language with the spatiotemporal representation and produces hierarchical outputs (global route + local control).
Online latent map/update and uncertainty-aware decision module to adapt planning and control in dynamically changing environments.
impact: LongFly improves the reliability and scalability of UAV VLN for long-horizon tasks such as search-and-rescue, offering practitioners a blueprint for integrating long-term multimodal context into navigation policies and real-world robotic deployments.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: camera + pose inputs → spatiotemporal memory/encoder → multimodal transformer → hierarchical planner/control.
Timeline/spatiotemporal heatmap showing how observations are aggregated over long horizons into a compact context vector.
Comparative trajectory map: baseline vs. LongFly showing smoother, more accurate long-horizon paths over a disaster-like scene.
Component icons: UAV camera, language bubble, memory bank, and planner/control loop to convey module roles at a glance.
paper_title: LongFly: Long-Horizon UAV Vision-and-Language Navigation with Spatiotemporal Context Integration
paper_authors: Wen Jiang, Li Wang, Kangyao Huang, Wei Fan, Jinyuan Liu
